name: Pershing Square
address: 90 E 42nd St, New York, NY 10017, USA

reviews.text: Nice restaurant, pleasant attentive staff

Super FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck, aber nicht so gÃ¼nstig.
Dennoch ist es eine schÃ¶ne AtmosphÃ¤re. Tlw sollte man einen Tisch reservieren. Ab 8 Uhr war es sehe voll.

Great place to eat and visit grand central station opposite. Food was not cheap but then neither was the quality of the food and service - so we felt it was worth the money and experience. Lovely cozy and old world feel but very busy and fairly noisy. We manage to time it right with a visit around 830 as it was starting to fill up by the time we left. I would recommend and visit again should we get the opportunity to visit NYC again.

We decided to try this restaurant for breakfast after hearing a recommendation, thinking it might be a worthwhile splurge. Unfortunately, it turned out to be a big disappointment from start to finish.

Right away, the prices raised eyebrows â€” a single Belgian waffle was around $24, as were the pancakes and omelette. Even a small cup of orange juice or coffee was $10 each. Still, we figured the quality or portion sizes might justify the cost. Sadly, that wasnâ€™t the case.

When the food arrived, the portions were surprisingly small. The omelette was a basic single-pan size, and the pancakes came as a small stack of three or four. Worse, the quality didnâ€™t match the upscale pricing. The eggs over medium were cold and overcooked on the outside, clearly from a griddle that was too hot, and even after being sent back, they returned warm but still burned. The pancakes looked nice at first but were doughy and undercooked in the middle â€” again, a sign of rushed or uneven cooking.

For such steep prices, the food was plain, poorly prepared, and nowhere near the level of quality youâ€™d expect. Honestly, the Dunkinâ€™ Donuts across the street could have provided a better breakfast for a fraction of the cost.

Overall, the experience was disappointing and not worth the premium price. If youâ€™re looking to spend a little more for great breakfast food, youâ€™re better off taking your money somewhere that actually delivers on flavor and quality.

I was really looking forward to a nice breakfast, but my experience here was pretty underwhelming, especially for the price. I ordered eggs that cost $22, and they arrived cold and frazzled, as if theyâ€™d been sitting out for a while. Unfortunately, the rest of the food didnâ€™t make up for it. The pancakes were doughy, the toast was hard, and the waffles were dryâ€”none of it tasted fresh or worth the high cost. Even small details were disappointing; the napkins felt like thin pieces of paper. On top of that, both the food and drinks were noticeably overpriced for what you get.

Overall, this meal felt like poor value for money. If youâ€™re considering coming here for breakfast or brunch, Iâ€™d recommend looking elsewhere for better quality and a fairer price.

Honestly I canâ€™t put it into words so Iâ€™ll make a haiku:
Each bite terrible
Another disappointment
Do not recommend

Convenient place near mid town for a standard meal. Lots of space so should be easy to get a table. Good options on the menu and food was prepared quickly. Food and service is above average. Cool place for tourists who want to get the â€œdinerâ€ experience.
altes Chatme ist schon toll, aber Massenabfertigung und viel zu Ã¼berteuert ... haben in einen kleinen BÃ¤ckerei fast neben an viel leckerer gegessen und preiswerter
Excelente lugar. Sempre que passava em frente achava que era sÃ³ um cafÃ©. Ao entrar.. que surpresa.. comida muito boa, com um preÃ§o meio caro, mas... vale pela experiÃªncia.
Among the best dinners we had while in NYC, which is saying a lot. I had the NY Strip (of course! ğŸ˜†) and my wife had the duck. The service was also excellent. Thank you Jonathan!
Nice location. Nothing special about the pancakes. Waiters demanded high tip. That left a bad taste..

I just wish it wasn't cold in the atrium because of the low ongoing air conditioning. It's already 50 degrees outside. I shouldn't be warmer outside then I am inside. But other than that, it's still nice to sit inside away from weather conditions. Just wished it was warmer.
Great place for breakgast before you head out to NYC.
I meet my friend here every time I come to NYC. Our tradition we have been doing for over 10 years. Their Benedict is really good.
Great place for breakfast and coffee. Good location.
Linda opciÃ³n para merendar y hacer un descanso si estuviste de recorrida todo el dÃ­a. Precios acorde al lugar y comodidad en la que se encuentra
Wonderfull place for a breakfast! Soooo nice and the eggs ğŸ¥°.

Came in the day before for a take away coffee which was really good. Decided to return as I'm craving a sit down meal after traveling. At first the eggs where under cooked, they fixed it but left me with over salted dry and chewy bacon. Go for the coffee but skip the rest. It's priced to highly to be bad.
She's pricey... but the MUST stop for a Bloody Mary.
Fabulous place for breakfast a bit on the expensive side but the food was so good including the coffee and the grapefruit juice, the service was also amazing!

Stopped at Pershing Square for dinner and had a NY Strip with mashed potatoes and a glass of Riesling. The steak was cooked perfectly and topped with a rich red wine sauce. The mashed potatoes were creamy and just right. The staff was attentive and quick, and they made sure to check in to see if everything was to my liking, which I really appreciated. The atmosphere was great, intimate, moody, and not too loud.

Ordered the omelette, not overwhelmed by the food quality.
Extremely noisy restaurant when it is busy.
Decent place right across the street from Grand Central.  Limited menu but some decent choices.
Amazing service from Elvis the manager will return
Great location right across the street from grand central. Food is great, great for large groups too.
Food was.ok, nothing delicious, but the staff was super friendly and I like the restaurant vibes, other than that it's expensive for what it is...
Good spot for breakfast

Extremely disappointing and concerning experience. During our visit last week, we ordered one round of drinks for four people and we wanted to pay shortly afterwards. The waiter joked, â€œI wonâ€™t charge too much,â€ but then processed two unauthorized charges on my card â€” one for $90 and another for $72 (where only one should have been taken).
We had only one bill and one payment, so these extra charges are clearly fraudulent.

Iâ€™ve tried several times to contact the business via Instagram, their website, and direct messages, but have received no response at all.

This feels like deliberate misuse of payment information, and the lack of accountability is unacceptable. I strongly warn others to avoid going to this place & paying by card here due to serious concerns about honesty and transparency.
â€” ValÃ©rie Kerstens

experienced my first case of racism in New York from host. As soon as I walked in, even though there were plenty of empty seats inside, they gave me a spot right at the entrance in the walkway. When I asked to change, they aggressively questioned me, like â€œWhatâ€™s wrong with this seat? Why do you want to move?â€ Eventually, I insisted and they did move me, but only to a seat next to the staff passage.
It wouldâ€™ve been easy to dismiss as them just being lazy, but while I was eating I kept watching. Every white customer got seated in the good spots inside, in the center.

Too overpriced! How are eggs benedicts and French toast close to $30? I would understand if they were exceptional but they are average at best.

I guess they get a lot of customers due to the location but even though I'm staying within walking distance I won't be coming back

Wonderful attentive friendly inclusive customer-oriented welcoming services delivered by gracious Server Ms. Lenka & Manager Elvis & the busboy (Sorry didnâ€™t get your name). My third visit here at Pershing Square & each time magnificent tasteful artistic decor, spotless & breakfast I ordered so delicious & lovely to view. The corned beef was home-made! Thank you Lenka for our conversation. Pershing Square was packed, a culinary hub across from iconic fellow hub Grand Central Station.  Grateful to you ALL!
Prices are incredibly high here because of tourist pricing. Taste is okay but nothing special. Lots of seating, and itâ€™s mostly a business clientele. Service is functional and efficient.
I guess itâ€™s a NYC classic and the location is great. Lovely servers who let us sit a long time. But lunch has limited options that are pricey and not such generous portions.
Great service! The food was good, but I didn't like the hot chocolate. It should be thicker!

I was walking around Grand Central area one day and walked in to this area. Lots of people sitting, standing and passing thru from and to Grand Central Station.  A very busy area. Restaurant on one side and coffee station on the other.
í˜¸ìŠ¤íŠ¸ê°€ ì¢Œì„ ë°°ì •í• ë•Œ ì¸ì¢…ì°¨ë³„ì´ ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.
Very nice .. i like being there

We arrived as it was due to open at 7am. There are two doors and the lady who came down to open them could clearly see us standing at one set of doors but for some reason decided to go to the other set of doors to open them first which felt very rude and in polite. I asked for some Tabasco sauce. The guy walked away and never returned. I asked another staff member for some Tabasco who promptly returned with a different brand of hot sauce showing just how slack the service is here. The corned beef hash that we ordered was greasy and hard to chew and the eggs were not cooked as requested. They also forgot extra items that we ordered. Just a complete shambles all round.
Delicious food, amazing, friendly staff! I had the pancakes which were delicious, but what I truly loved was how friendly the staff was! Customer service 5+
A classic breakfast, lunch, after work drinks spot for NYC's media elite. If these walls could talk. Great location directly across from Grand Central.
Ottimo il servizio il cibo in un ambiente molto curato
Love this place! Food is great

This restaurant has my endless affection. Their service personnel operated flawlessly. You can taste the freshness, perfect seasoning, and proper cooking in every bite. This spot maintains hygiene without feeling sterile. I suggest trying everything they serve.
Einen wundervollen Martini genossen. Der Barkeeper war super aufmerksam und sehr unterhaltsam. WÃ¤hrend ich das schreibe habe ich direkt wieder Lust vorbei zu schauen. Sehr cooles Lokal!

Long-time breakfast/brunch spot that I never miss. The blueberry pancakes are just delicious! I also had the Eggs Benedict and hubs had a waffle with bacon and eggs. We both found the food prepared with care. Service was friendly and responsive to any special requests.  Nice location when you're near Grand Central Station. Have been here many times and always look forward to going back.
My favorite breakfast & prosecco place! ğŸ˜ŠPerfect service!â€¦
Przepyszne Å›niadanka.
Always a pleasure dining at Pershing Square. Excellent food, friendly and attentive service, and very relaxing atmosphere.

Walked by this place for years and always wanted to stop by! Quintessential authentic old school NYC style inside which I love. Staff was attentive and friendly. Havenâ€™t tried the food - will have to stop by and give it a try.
Yes, go.  We just stopped by to have a snack and a drink.  The service was attentive, and the bartenders knew what they were doing.  It was a great start to our evening.

ì»¤í”¼ê°€ë§›ìˆëŠ”ê³³ ì˜ì™¸ì˜ ë¡œì»¬ë§›ì§‘
íŒ¬ì¼€ì´í¬ê°€ ì •ë§ ë§›ìˆì—ˆì–´ìš”!

My first time at Pershing Square and I was not disappointed! I ordered the fettuccine pasta with vegetables in a pesto sauce for lunch and it was amazing. The portion was generous and I ate the whole thing! Food baby! The service was great. As a matter fact, we had several servers and they were all very polite, friendly. Decent prices too. My entreÃ© was $22.  The only thing I didnâ€™t care for was how loud it was!  Overall, I highly recommend Pershing Square for a business lunch, out with friends, maybe not a first date if you want to talk and get to know each other.

Beautiful space and great service. Iâ€™ve been here for breakfast several times because I often have morning meetings nearby. Today came for lunch with my wife and we had vegetarian chili, avocado salad, and creamed spinach to split. The chili was frankly awful. Just a lot of canned tomatoes and overcooked onions with chili powder. The salad and spinach were great. The service was wonderful as always and the space is beautiful. So, while this is not in my top 100 best restaurants in NYC, I do recommend itâ€”especially for breakfast.

Good quality breakfast in the Grand Central area. The location is ideal for a business meeting or catching a good meal before or after traveling. I ordered the poached eggs with quinoa and lentils, and it was just the right healthy and filling meal I needed. The restaurant is pricier than most breakfast locations but it also offers a high class environment and service. I enjoyed my visit.

The food and service were amazing.  This restaurant never disappoints.  This is a wonderful brunch spot in NYC that is just steps away from Grand Central Station.  My 7 yr old daughter loves this spot!

You can also grab lunch and dinner here, too. It works great for a quick lunch if you only have a little time in between meetings.
Little expensive. However, its a beautiful brunch spot. The food was presented beautifully, the staff was pleasant, and I love that someone from the kitchen brings your food to you personally.

ã”é¦³èµ°ã•ã¾ã§ã—ãŸ

A beautiful and classic American restaurant nestled in the heart of the city, right across from Grand Centralâ€”one of the true gems of Beaux-Arts architecture. The atmosphere is truly unique, making this spot a must-visit. I had the classic burger, which was delicious. Definitely recommended!

Iâ€™ve been here a few times while visiting NYC. Iâ€™ve enjoyed both breakfast and lunch. The menu options are vast, including several vegetarian options. The food is always delicious and the staff always friendly and welcoming.  The service is quick, so you donâ€™t have to wait around forever for your food even with a party of six people.
I love the location and the restaurant has a very cool vibe.  Lots of windows and a large bar area, high ceilings and bright colored walls. A fun place for all ages.

Stopped by Pershing Square CafÃ© on Friday afternoon for a quick snack and coffee. We ordered a cappuccino, hot cocoa, and a chocolate croissant. The drinks were warm and comforting, and the croissant was fresh and flaky.

The cafÃ© wasnâ€™t crowded, making it a peaceful spot to relax in the midst of the cityâ€™s hustle. The ambiance was charming, with its classic bistro feel right across from Grand Central Terminal. ï¿¼

Service was prompt and friendly. Itâ€™s a great place for a quick break or a casual meet-up. Highly recommend if youâ€™re in the area and looking for a cozy cafÃ© experience.

Visited Pershing Square for breakfast with my sister, and the experience was quite disappointing. The host at the entrance seemed unfriendly and gave off a very negative vibe, making us uncomfortable. He appeared completely disinterested in tourists like us, but was noticeably more polite and welcoming to people in suits. We were directed to a table that hadnâ€™t been cleaned, and when we pointed it out, he didnâ€™t respond well. Unfortunately, the food didnâ€™t make up for it â€” the Eggs Benedict were overcooked and lacked flavor.

His ( host) attitude completely ruined our day in the morning itself. Wouldnâ€™t recommend this spot to tourists â€” especially if youâ€™re looking to start your day with warmth and good food.

Great place for brunch!  This place is literally across from Grand Central!  The food came pretty quickly and was delish. Highly recommend chicken club sandwich and chicken pot pie.   Why did i give service 4 stars.  One our waiter came by once to ask if everything was good and then returned later to say because of shift change he wanted to introduce the new waiter taking over.  The bathrooms were disgusting per my friend and we got there at 12.  Another customer complained and they were cleaned.  I donâ€™t use public bathrooms too often so not an issue for me.  Over all was a good experience.

We visited when the AC was broken, but the food was still good. My only complaint is that for my party of three they automatically added an 18% gratuity and then listed suggested gratuity and a spot to write in tip on our credit receipt. Gratuity by its definition should never be automatically added by the restaurant without prior warning. I think this was a violation of NYC regulations to apply automatically to a party of 3.

Iâ€™ve gone several times but this last time was meh
The kitchen was very slow, the food took a lot of time to arrive, the order of my husband arrived with the wrong item and had to wait a lot, his food came after Iâ€™ve almost finished mine. I must highlight that the servers had a good service, only the food was very slow.
The hot chocolate drink is a must! Would return for the chocolate drink but not for the food.
The place had a good atmosphere

Mixed experience.
A big thank you to the waiter who took care of our table. He was as warm as could be and gave excellent advice. But before he helped us, his two female colleagues simply ignored us. Itâ€™s not very pleasant to see them deliberately avoid eye contact and the calls from my family, just one meter from our table.
The kind gentleman served us and even got scolded by one of the women, which I didnâ€™t really understand, given that he was the only one running around and actually taking care of us. ğŸ˜…

Classic New York layout and atmosphere here. Wonderful service. Serves plenty of business-goers for breakfast before they begin the day around the buildings and also those looking for a quick shot of coffee. We had breakfast here and in particular the eggs set - was well done overall though nothing too fantastic I would say. Very American style and a good decent one at a pretty reasonable price. Alfresco dining also available. It can get pretty noisy indoors as well due to the morning crowd. Located within Grand Central Terminal and very visible once you exist via 42nd Street. Heard their waffles are great too; will be back to try in the future and maybe for lunch!
This is a great restaurant, we came here twice during our stay for breakfast. It isn't cheap, but the service was excellent and the food delicious!
The location is so beautiful. You cant get more New York than that! . I loved my tender and deliciously fresh Waldorf salad. Staff is always so attentive and elegant.

éå¸¸ä¸èµ·çœ¼çš„é è¿‘ä¸­å¤®è»Šç«™çš„å¤§å¤§å¯¶è—åº—ï¼Œå…¥å£æ˜¯éå¸¸çµ¢éº—50æˆ–æ˜¯60å¹´ä»£æ„Ÿçš„å·´å£«å…¥å£ï¼Œé€²å»å¾Œæ•´å€‹é¤å»³åˆ¥æœ‰æ´å¤©ã€‚æœå‹™å“¡æœƒè©¢å•è¦åƒåˆé¤é‚„æ˜¯ä¸‹åˆèŒ¶ç­‰ç­‰ï¼Œæˆ‘å€‘æ˜¯é¸åƒæ—©åˆé¤ï¼Œæ‡‰è©²æ˜¯èœå–®æœƒæœ‰æ‰€ä¸åŒã€‚é‡‘é¡ç®—æ˜¯åé«˜ï¼Œä¸”ä¸€åˆ‡éƒ½éå¸¸çš„å„ªé›…ï¼Œæœå‹™å“¡çš„é€é¤ä»¥åŠæ¡Œé‚Šæœå‹™éƒ½å¾ˆæ£’ã€‚æ³•å¼åå¸å¾ˆå¥½åƒï¼Œå¦‚æœéœ€è¦èœ‚èœœå¯ä»¥å†å¤šç´¢å–ã€‚
Had a Great lunch here. Place is always hopping giving it a nice vibe. Staff was very attentive and the Cobb and Waldorf salads we had were excellent.

The location is prime with plenty of seats. I heard a lot of good things about this place, however, my experience wasnâ€™t great.
